newsitem.title: CHINA: North China port coal capacity to hit 100 mln T/yr.
newsitem.headline: North China port coal capacity to hit 100 mln T/yr.

text.p: The coal handling capacity of Qinhuangdao port in north China will rise to 100 million tonnes annually when an expansion is completed in July, the Xinhua news agency said on Thursday.
Qinhuangdao handled a total of 83.12 million tonnes of cargo in 1996, including 65 million tonnes of coal and 11 million tonnes of crude oil, Xinhua said.
Before the one billion yuan ($120 million) expansion plan began in 1993, capacity was about 70 million tonnes.
Qinhuangdao mainly ships coal from China's largest coal base, northern Shanxi province, to coastal provinces in the south, Xinhua said. The port also exports 20 million tonnes of coal annually.
